questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct?

answer.text: We use data for a sample to quantify the parameters for the population.

feedback.text: Close, but wrong. We estimate rather than quantify.

answer.text: We use data for a population to quantify the parameters for the sample.

feedback.text: False. We use a sample to estimate parameters for the population.

answer.text: We use data for a sample to estimate the parameters for the population.

feedback.text: Correct!

answer.text: We use data for a population to estimate the parameters for the sample.

feedback.text: False. We use a sample to estimate parameters for the population.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is correct?

answer.text: We use data for a population to estimate the parameters for the sample.

feedback.text: False. We use a sample to estimate parameters for the population.

answer.text: We use data for a sample to estimate the parameters for the population.

feedback.text: Correct!

answer.text: We use data for a sample to quantify the parameters for the population.

feedback.text: Close, but wrong. We estimate rather than quantify.

answer.text: We use data for a population to quantify the parameters for the sample.

feedback.text: False. We use a sample to estimate parameters for the population.

answer.text: We use data for a sample to quantify the parameters for the population.

feedback.text: Close, but wrong. We estimate rather than quantify.

answer.text: We use data for a sample to estimate the parameters for the population.

feedback.text: Correct!

answer.text: We use data for a population to quantify the parameters for the sample.

feedback.text: False. We use a sample to estimate parameters for the population.

answer.text: We use data for a population to estimate the parameters for the sample.

feedback.text: False. We use a sample to estimate parameters for the population.

questiontext.text: Which of the following is NOT correct?

answer.text: A value calculated using all the data from a sample is called a statistic.

feedback.text: False. A value calculated using all the data from a population is called a parameter.

answer.text: A value calculated using all the data from a sample is called an estimate.

feedback.text: False. A value calculated using all the data from a population is called a parameter.

answer.text: A value calculated using all the data from a population is called a statistic.

feedback.text: False. A value calculated using all the data from a population is called a parameter.

answer.text: A value calculated using all the data from a population is called a parameter.

feedback.text: Correct!
